metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10992 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: lilypond-invoke-editor in LilyPond 2.19.80 does not validate strings before launching the program specified by the BROWSER environment variable, which allows remote attackers to conduct argument-injection attacks via a crafted URL, as demonstrated by a --proxy-pac-file argument, because the GNU Guile code uses the system Scheme procedure instead of the system* Scheme procedure. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-17523.

criterions.comment: lilypond: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
